p: A recent study [ 24] showed that SO ethanol extract significantly inhibited the proliferation of RL 95-2 human endometrial cancer cells. Furthermore, SO ethanol extract was effective against A549 (lung cancer), HepG2 (hepatpma), MDA-MB-231 (breast cancer), and especially on LNCaP (prostate cancer) cell lines. At the same time, it was reported that caryophyllene oxide (IC 50 value = 14.90 μg/mL) and caryophyllene (IC 50 value = 33.20 μg/mL) were mainly responsible for most cytotoxic activity of SO ethanol extract against RL 95-2 cells. As mentioned previously in Section 2.1, there are only four common compounds in the three essential oils, and caryophyllene oxide is one of the four common components in the three essential oils.
